title: Frankolala
author: Frankolala
created_time: September 07, 2022, 04:08:21 PMLast edit: September 07, 2022, 07:57:49 PM by Frankolala
content: Three weeks ago I got employed as a Civil servant,in my place of work I went round from department to department,offices to offices asking my colleagues if they have heard or learnt about Bitcoin. To my greatest surprise only few of them have heard about Bitcoin, but they don't understand how it bitcoin works. ¬† ¬†I will like Bitcoin to be adopted in my country as a ledger tender,just like El Salvador and Central Republic of Africa that are Bitcoin friendly. ¬†For this to be achieved,I have taken it upon myself to go extra miles,to start introducing Bitcoin and its basic concept to people in my locality and place of work voluntarily. If they have the awareness and understanding of how Bitcoin works and its Decentralization, then they can start giving a trial of investing or saving in bitcoin. ¬† ¬†From my locality and place of work, Bitcoin information will be spread to other places. ¬†¬† ¬†¬† ¬† If so many persons are involved in the Blockchain, when our government notice this,they will be left with no option than to embrace this new era ,believing they will be able to generate tax for the country. ¬† I have printed flyers and shared round for easy contact. Do you think this will make my goal come true ?

comments.author: bitcampaign
comments.body: some countries are already aware of the huge advantages of the bitcoin tax so they are now starting to campaign with bitcoin one of which is my country has now started to legalize a crypto mining because the government is starting to feel the big benefits of this crypto tax, actually you can do the same thing introducing bitcoin to people around you but as a suggestion you also need to learn a lot from this forum, many of them have interesting experiences for you to follow

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Talking about bitcoin to those who express interest is cool, but we should not expect that everyone should get into it. It's perfectly fine for someone not to be interested in Bitcoin and they should not be compelled to change their stance, except they show interest to do so.Also, if you are interested in growing awareness about Bitcoin, using already available content is good enough. This would help prevent passing on inaccurate information to people, or getting them to understand it the way you do.Quote from: Frankolala on September 07, 2022, 04:08:21 PMIf so many persons are involved in the Blockchain, when our government notice this,they will be left with no option than to embrace this new era,believing they might generate tax from Bitcoin. Getting governments interested in taxations from Bitcoin is not a flex at all.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: You tried your best from your end. Make sure your country allows you to use crypto, so you will not in trouble later on. We should adapt Bitcoin to the next generation and our friend's circle. So they could learn about Bitcoin and how it works. Otherwise, our next generation will learn from where. Most important is to share proper knowledge about Bitcoin. So they won't be misguided. Keep it up mate and help Bitcoin adaption.

comments.author: Jiovanni
comments.body: I think every step taken to GENUINELY promote bitcoin should be applaudedüëè, as it's essential to aiding our trading and investment. Howbeit, let's be guided and not try forcing people, else they might see it as scam.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: That's good and well done Franko, although it's going to be a long way to go you did it by having that initiative. About investing, I think many will still doubt you on this not until they've fully understood what you're teaching them. That's okay but don't feel bad and down when those people who you shared with those brochures and invitations of yours will think like that. Many will tell you that they're interested and will praise what you've told them about bitcoin but in the application of the actual buying and investing, not everyone who said that will have to walk the talk.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: Anyone who takes the initiative to spread bitcoin or teach bitcoin a lesson to people who don't understand or know bitcoin is a very noble job, and spreading bitcoin in any way is the obligation of those of us who have been involved to have the awareness to do so, so that bitcoin is widespread and many are involved .indeed I admit there are still very many people who don't know what bitcoin is, let alone blockchain and decentralization, and I also do the same thing when I'm elsewhere I will ask several people if they know or know bitcoin and it turns out that many don't and that's where we have to tell them at least a few sentences that are easy to understand and make them curious and find out for themselves.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on September 07, 2022, 04:08:21 PMThree weeks ago I got employed as a Civil servant,in my place of work I went round from department to department,offices to offices asking my colleagues if they have heard or learnt about Bitcoin.Be careful bruh, you could surely get into trouble with your employers if you come off as being a disturbance to your new colleagues in your workplace, personally i will not talk about bitcoin in my work place, unless someone shows interest in the network, then if i can be of help to them in any little way i can, then i will, but to be employed just three weeks ago and you are in everyone's office talking about bitcoin; that may not be the correct way to go.Needless to say that as you try to teach people about bitcoin, you should also protect yourself and your privacy, you can be attacked by someone who feels you have money because you talked about bitcoin, you don't know most of your new workers, neither do you know their past record, i will prefer to play safe if i were you. It goes without saying that i am not against spreading the word about bitcoin, but it should be done decently and in a way that would not put the preacher into trouble.

comments.author: dark1234
comments.body: good things are a good start too, but educating or explaining bitcoin to them at work is not appropriate because we have to be professional with work, but during breaks it is the most possible thing to ask and tell, what is bitcoin?? ? , although this is still not optimal but at least they know and hear about bitcoin which will stimulate curiosity to know more about bitcoin, so they can find sources of information in the media and the web about bitcoin, they will even become members of a new forum here, for those who have an interest while for those who don't, we certainly can't force them

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: I love the initiative recently, but for the love of god don't go down the route of telling people why Bitcoin is great. Simply show them what you can do, and the benefits of doing it, but don't tell them they need it. It's not for everyone, not in it's current implementation or state, and it almost becomes a little preachy when you come across as telling them why something's so great, and what they're missing out on. I find it a lot, spreading information is all well, and good or teaching someone something, but if it isn't being told or taught the right way, it can actually be detrimental. Make sure you know your stuff, and you go about it the right way.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: I believe that with the use of social networks better individual intentions can be directed, if with the Internet in more than 12 years we are at the level we are, do you sincerely believe that making a few copies and delivering them on foot can have a better reach? In any case how can you measure the result of what you do.If you think you are a disseminator, find other ways, always go to the highest link of communication, if you are in a company go to human resources or the person who employed you and tell him if you can give voluntary information about bitcoin, if there is a station in your sector radio go and tell them that you have the ability to answer questions about bitcoin, look for an influencer from your country or region write to him, there are so many more factual ways to reach greater reach.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: It is a very nice initiative and a sacrifice to make bitcoin adoption keep growing. Do you also have a rented house to teach the people you invited or you will teach them person by person. Do you really have the time.I surely have planned to teach people about bitcoin but it must be my relatives or friends. I cannot go to a total stranger to talk to the person about bitcoin, my personal opinion. Since you are newly employed, ask your boss or check their body language if what you are doing doesn't affect them in any way or not interfering with your own job.

comments.body: This is a good initiative and I hope to see how you intend to spread the news so people can get to learn about Bitcoin and how it works. Leaning about Bitcoin can be a big opportunities for everyone that are ready to learn and embrace it without bordering about what the government thought about it. Many persons had become so successful with Bitcoin and it will be an opportunity for others too to join and learn to see through the benefits of investing in digital gold. Many people need to learn about it although this may not be that effective but can be a tool to reach to people around you so they can learn the fundamentals of tapping into the world of cryptocurrency.

comments.body: African countries have been experiencing good rise in the usage of cryptocurrencies. Particularly many people are sharing what they know about bitcoin and trying their best to create awareness among the common public. People truly find the innovation to be a game changer in their economy as well as to play a big role in the country. This is why people keep on spreading about bitcoin.Once a person gets to know about it, further he/she have got good number of ways to learn better about it.
